fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36546].
  {panel}

I see from the related issue that you did add CQL, but I was talking about using it Inside of a Macro to return CONTENT, not a just a list of pages from the search bar. I want to return content from pages by using CQL parameters. This would be useful.

You could match on labels, creation time, space, attachments, whether it has children, etc.

You could match on some of the attributes here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/confluence/latest/reference/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.html


I ran into the need when I wanted to include all of the pages of the children of a parent essentially the cross between the page include and the children include macros. However there were so many pages it would be very tedious to do so with page includes.

 I started writing a macro for it, but I don't think we should need to make our own macros to do something so simple.  The Macro I was writing nearly works, but it doesn't include the macros that are on the pages of the children, so all panels and other stuff are lost essentially.

Even that however, was a workaround for what I really needed.

What I really needed was to include the content of all children of a certain parents who matched a certain creation date. So I could have 1 dynamic page, whose content changed day to day based on which pages matched the creation date parameters. A shift log that would always have content from  a time-span of 24-0 hours ago.

Now if CQL worked with the page include macro, then that would solve my issue.
fields.summary: CQL to return content WITHIN a Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36514].
  {panel}

Confluence is not able to detect existing database with contents in it (except Confluence database). Confluence will overwrite any existing database with contents in it (except any existing Confluence database) during database setup. Unlike Jira or Crowd, Confluence will not prompt any warning to the user if the chosen database contains any contents in it. Instead, it automatically overwrites and creates Confluence tables in the chosen database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence.
# Start Confluence Setup in the browser.
# Choose *Production Installation*.
# Enter License Key.
# Select *External Database* option under *Database Configuration* page.
# Choose *Direct JDBC* option.
# Insert the URL for any database that contains contents.
(i.e. MySQL: {{jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradatabase?sessionVariables=storage_engine%3DInnoDB}})
# Click *Next*.
# Observe the results.
# Execute the following SQL query via a database client to examine the database Confluence installed on:
{code:sql}SHOW tables;{code}

h3. Expected Behaviour
!prompt.png|thumbnail!
* Confluence setup should prompt a warning to the user before overwriting any existing database with contents.
* Confluence should also check whether the tables cwd_* are existed in the database, as the name is shared across all Atlassian Product. 

h3. Actual Behaviour
• Confluence will proceed database setup if the chosen database wasn't a Confluence database.

h6. Note
(!) This has been tested with any kind of databases (i.e. Jira, Crowd or custom database).
fields.summary: Confluence database detection should included the embedded crowd tables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36513].
  {panel}

HTML Export fails when there is non-existing attachment. I confirmed it happens both in the latest Confluence Server and in the latest Confluence Cloud.

h3. How I reproduced:
# Install vanilla Confluence Server 5.7
# Create a Space
# Create a Page in the Space
# Attache a file on the Page
# Back Up Confluence Data after unchecking "Back up attachments"
# Restore Confluence Data from the backup file, so that the page has an attachment which does not exist actually
# Go to the Space Tool and do HTML Export, which will end in failure

h3. Workaround:
Delete such non-existing attachments as described in the following page before doing HTML Export:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF52/Deleting+an+Attachment
fields.summary: HTML Export fails when there is non-existing attachment
Allow page editting approval.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36508].
  {panel}

As of now, Confluence file preview features doesn't include {{.txt}}  as one of the previewable file types. It's great that Confluence is able to preview complicated file types as describe in [Confluence 5.7 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Filesarefirstclasscitizens]:

||Image Files||Office Files||Other Files||
|JPEG|DOC|PDF|
|PNG|DOCX| |
|TIFF|PPT| |
|PSD|PPTX| |
|WMF|XLS| |
|EMF|XLSX| |
|ICO| | |
|ICNS| | |

It would be even better if Confluence include a simple *.txt* files into that list, and the ability to preview a *.html* and *.msg* file as well.
fields.summary: Preview file experience to include .txt file, .html file, .msg file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36497].
  {panel}

Note: If you are using version 5.8.16 or 5.8.17, or have used those versions in the past without running a script to fix the affected files, then you are likely affected by CONF-39975. Please see that ticket instead.

We found out that some of our Confluence pages have "unknown attachments". There are multiple pages that shows "unknown attachments". 
Here are some details:
- Attachment images are still there and can be viewed in some pages, but some other page attachments are gone and also not visible in the page.
- This is not true for all. Some pages have no attachment images at all, but the images are visible with in the page.
- Workaround is to re-add the attachment image to the macro but since we don't know how many pages are effected, it would be better if there is a fix to apply.
- We are not sure if it is caused by moving pages within or another space, but this issue is now found in many other spaces.

Confluence version: 5.4.4

*Note* This issue was resolved in favour of CONF-41067, which has much more clarity. Please follow that issue after reading the description if you still think this affects you.
fields.summary: Attachment missing in confluence pages
None

h3. Fix

Upgrade to [Confluence Document Conversions Library 1.9.8|https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/confluence-document-conversion-library/1.9.8/confluence-document-conversion-library-1.9.8.jar]
fields.summary: Error When Creating Pages Or Duplicating/Copying Pages (Cloud)
Upload attachment from URL
Confluence should disable the other user directories and enable Crowd directory when SSO is enable
Download link in my.atlassian.com always point to the latest version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36483].
  {panel}

When I insert an Office/Excel document display macro, it comes with a link that says "Edit this document" above the rendered document in the page.

It is very irritating to have a link like this, where it invites you to click on it, but then says "ha ha, you can't do that, you have the wrong browser".

You should either detect that I have the wrong browser and not offer me the link, or give me the option in the macro to not show that link.

No-one in our organisation uses Firefox or IE.
fields.summary: Option to remove "Edit this document" link in Office/Excel macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36482].
  {panel}

On this page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF34/Attaching+Files+to+a+Page#

There is a note that says "this is the old version, click here to see the new version of this doco"

That link points to the same old page.

This is a particular nuisance, because when googling about Attaching Files in Confluence, all the top hits are to this old page.
fields.summary: Old doco link to new doco doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36481].
  {panel}

Hello,
one of our clients asks about the ability to select multiple pages in a space or even in different spaces and apply label to a batch of selected pages.
He says, and I quote: " I would like to be able to select multiple pages in the wiki and the add/remove a label to all of the pages at once. Currently, you have to add labels one page at a time.  This is painful when you decide to gather a bunch of content under a new label.
This is a feature request to Atlasssian not a support ticket."
fields.summary: Apply label to multiple pages in local instance of confluence. Not cloud service.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36480].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
# Use an @mention in a comment
# View it on the page - the full name is displayed (see screenshot [^AtMentionOKonPage.png])
# View the comment in All Updates, the user name is displayed (see screenshot [^AtMentionUserName.png])

Our customer would like the full name to be displayed on the All Updates tab just as it is on the page.
fields.summary: For @mentions in comments please display full name instead of user name on All Updates tab

Confluence Tasks: Provide Filter on [Current-User]
JIRA Issues Macro - Cannot sort for component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36476].
  {panel}

After Confluence Cloud was upgraded to 5.7-OD-42, the contributors macro stopped working properly. Not all watchers are added, even thought 'watchers' is selected.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Have a 5.7-OD-42 Confluence Cloud instance (only tested in JIRA+Confluence ones)
* Create a page (you should be automatically added as watcher, if not, do it)
* Add the contributors macro to it
** Contribution type:
{noformat}
authors,comments,mentions,watches
{noformat}
*** Leaving only 'watches' also reproduces the problem
** Sort by: name
** Display format: list
** The rest is empty

*Expected result*
* The page's author should be part of the list
** (S)he is both author and watcher

*Actual Result*
* The following message:
{noformat}
No contributors found for: watches on selected page(s)
{noformat}

Sometimes, when changing the macro and saving it. It starts working for no reason.

Reports seem to indicate that it worked before the upgrade.
fields.summary: Contributors Macro is not working properly for Watchers after update
implement a way to encrypt JNDI database configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36474].
  {panel}

Although the following documentation mention MySQL to be supported, the two most common flavors of MySQL are not specifically listed as ones that likely will cause issues.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL

MariaDB and Percona are proven to cause problems with Confluence and we have open feature requests to support those (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36471, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29060), but since the documentation do not specifically mention they are not supported, in many cases users will make the assumption they are okay to use.
fields.summary: Documentation request: mention not supported flavors of MySQL
CQL has no limit capability, as a remote addon I want the latest X capped at n entries, regardless of dates added
Support for Percona DB

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36470].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

Currently there is no option to filter users or groups that are synced from a JIRA directory.

*Example*
User connect Confluence to JIRA for user management.  They would like to filter only a certain user/group from Jira to Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow groups and users synced from a JIRA directory to be filtered

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h6. Steps to replicate
# create a space
# Create a page named "Meeting notes" inside that space
# On this page at the "Create from templates" Macro with the following settings:
#* Button text: Create meeting note
#* Template name: Meeting notes
# Save the page
# Click the button "Creating meeting note" and save the page


h6. Observed Behavior
Another page with the name "Meeting notes (2)" is generated

h6. Expected Behavior
Doesn't create a new index page because it should have recognizes that there is already a page called "Meeting notes" or a warning stating that there is aalready page name with meeting notes.
fields.summary: Create template macro create duplicates page

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36464].
  {panel}

At All People view, open and edit a version of the duplicate, say adding a photo, after save, both record will have the updated photo displayed.

How to clean-up/remove the duplicate?

Note, if at a Confluence document, manage Watchers, typing in the person (with the duplicated record), both duplicates will appear but only one with the updated photo.

At Site Administration > User Management, can only see one reference to the person.

Apparently, the user was created by system administrator.  Later, the user created himself upon the login Confluence process, and specified the same email address.

Hope the information helps.

Many thanks.
Frankey

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36445].
  {panel}

I was thinking it would be really cool if you guys added CQL. Essentially a query language that returns pages or attributes from pages that meet certain criteria.

You could match on labels, creation time, space, attachments, whether it has children, etc.


You could match on some of the attributes here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/confluence/latest/reference/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.html


I ran into the need when I wanted to include all of the pages of the children of a parent. However there were so many it would be very tedious to do so with page includes. I started writing a macro for it, but I don't think we should need to make our own macros to do something so simple. 


Even that however was a workaround for what I really needed.

What I really needed was to include the content of all children of a certain parents who matched a certain creation date.
fields.summary: CQL return pages or content, etc, that match certain criteria

It would be great if Confluence have a feature where when the status macro is being added to a table then the text can be automatically added to the page itself.

h4. Description
When a space contains orphaned pages (that are not children of the home page) the page tree will not display any orphan pages

h4. Steps to Replicate

# Create a new page in that space.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36434].
  {panel}


# create a JIRA issue
# create a page in Confluence
# mention the JIRA issue in the Confluence page
# refresh & check the JIRA issue is updated in the _mentioned in_ section
# -copy the Confluence page-
# create a fresh page adn add the JIRA issue mention to it
# refresh & check the new -copy- page appears in the mentioned in section on the JIRA issue
# edit the -copy- new page to remove the JIRA issue mention, replace it with the word "deleted"
# refresh & check the JIRA issue is updated

_Edit: the copy page step is not necessary to reproduce._

+Expected Behaviour+
The JIRA issue updates to match the confluence page

+Actual Behaviour+
The issue no longer mentioned in Confluence still appears on the JIRA issue. It appears the deletion of the JIRA issue is not communicated back to JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36415].
  {panel}

Clarification: Inline comments are not supported within some macros (for example, a code macro).  The below documents a different scenario.

h6. Steps to replicate - FIXED in 5.9
# Install Confluence 5.7
# Create a new space
# Create 2 page under the new space. (e.g. Testing and Testing2)
# Add a label in Testing page. ( e.g add label name Test)
# In Testing2 add a macro name "label list"
# In the same page (Testing2) add the following line:
{code}I would like to Test this page {code}
# Highlight the word "Test" and add comment

h6. In Confluence Cloud
# Create a new page
# Add a page properties macro
# Insert any text inside the macro
# Publish the page
# Highlight the text that was inserted inside the macro and add an inline comment


h6. Alternate steps to replicate (tested with Confluence 5.8.15) - STILL BROKEN
# In a space, create two pages: Test1 and Test2 
# On Test1, add the following text: "Link to a page"
# Underneath that text, add a link in which the link text is "Link to a page" and the target is the Test2 page 
# Save the page
# Highlight any of the words in the text (not link) "Link to a page" and add an inline comment


h6. Observed Behavior
I see the below error:
{code}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{code}

h6. Expected Behavior
The user should be able to add a comment.

h6. Observations

Confluence thinks some pieces of text is an inline macro when it's really not - inline comments should be possible.

h6. Notes
The text highlighted doesn't allow the comment inline to be added, it is grayed out on the new editor, however, it doesn't happen on the legacy editor.
It doesn't work for a few macros and for tables as well on the new editor.
fields.summary: Extend inline comment to work on all macros

Same behavior that was Fixed in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28401 on version 5.5 but reoccurring in 5.6 confluence.

h3.Reproduce:
- create user with Full name *User One*
- @mention user in confluence
- change users Full Name to *anything else*
- try to @mention *anything else*

h3.Expected
users full name anything else will be found and mentioned

h3.Actual
user not found
BUT ...
- you can still @mention *User One*

Additional Note:
Content re-index does not clear this out
fields.summary: After user changes Full Name the @mention does not work correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36406].
  {panel}

When Confluence gives the *Use* permissions for anonymous in Confluence, it will let any anonymous edit or create content in the instance. However, when an anonymous is creating content or editing a page, the following message is presented:

!anonymous.png!

The reason for asking to modify this message would be regarding. Companies that allow only employees to have login in the instance. Otherwise, if the anonymous user is not aware about it, he could send messages to the administrator to ask for a login. Depending on the number of anonymous, it could need some extra work.

A good suggestion would be to remove the login link for anonymous user in that message.
fields.summary: Customise the Message for Anonymous with Access to Edit Pages
Display Emoticons in TOC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36401].
  {panel}

The Roadmap Planner is a great addition to Confluence, but lacks the ability to be resized or resize itself automatically based on content.  

Vertically, the lane labels are very short and cannot display something as simple as the word "General" without being cut off (with 2 lanes).

Horizontally, the bar text does not auto-shrink if the bar is too short to display the label.

Additionally, the editor view does not give you an accurate representation of what it will look like when you save the page.  There are 3 stages of how you will see the content, and they all are inconsistent (see attached screenshots)

1-In the actual macro editor
2-Once you click Insert on the macro editor, but before the page saved
3-Once you click Save and view the page as normal

I would suggest allowing the ability for this to be resized manually or have the label text auto-shrink to the size of the fields.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner - Ability To Resize or Expand to Content/Preview Inconsistencies

Error is also encountered when editing the Restrictions Group of an existing URL in Application Navigator. But changes will still be saved when you update the Restrictions Group. 
{quote} Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved.
Try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, please contact your System Administrator.{quote}

h4. Workaround - Confluence Server only
# Stop Confluence
# Download {{commons-validator-1.40.jar}} from https://maven.atlassian.com/content/groups/public/commons-validator/commons-validator/1.4.0/commons-validator-1.4.0.jar
# Copy {{commons-validator-1.40.jar}} to {{<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}}
# Start Confluence

h4. Cloud instance with Confluence & JIRA:
* Add the Link to the JIRA Application Navigator and it will be synced with Confluence in a few minutes.
* For Confluence only instances there is no workaround at the moment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36388].
  {panel}

Hi 

We had some trouble regarding compatibility with Confluence  5.7 and our Theme add-on Enterprise Theme [1].

The main reasons where UI related with your new feature Inline Commenting.
Because of a different DOM in our Theme and the fact that you are adding the right padding directly to the #content element (without using a css class :( ), the Theme looked ugly, because in our theme the inline style has to be at another place. 

In the pre versions wasn't any event which we could listen on, so that we where not able to fix that layout issue. In the release version you added a set of new events, fired by Backbone, which gives us a chance to fix the layout - Thank you! 

But events are sometimes lazy and inline styles aren't such a good way - so I just like to ask you, if it's possible to change this implementation in using a css class on the body like "has-inline-comments-panel" or something else, where the padding is connected to. 

This will make the integration of the inline commenting more easy. 

Thank you 
Oliver Straesser

[1] https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.getunik.confluence.skin.core
fields.summary: Inline comments integration issue with Enterprise Theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36332].
  {panel}

When editing a Confluence page on Atlassian Cloud, images no longer correctly display the properties > effects that have been selected.

Steps to reproduce:
Create confluence page
Attach an image
Select the image in the editor window
Click the image and select properties
Apply any type of effect to the image
Save the page

No image effect is rendered. 

Note also that the various effects do not display properly in the properties lightbox.

h3.Update
The effects will still render in Preview, or in the Editor, but will not render when the page is saved
fields.summary: Confluence Image effects do not render

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36322].

To Reproduce:
# Create a page using any blueprint (Retrospective, Product Requirements, Troubleshooting, Meeting Notes, etc.)
# Before saving, click Location and change the space and parent page
# When you save the page an error appears:
The following error(s) occurred:
The parent page specified does not exist. It may have been renamed or deleted since you started editing.

Nothing is written to the atlassian-confluence.log when this occurs.

Tested on Confluence 5.4.3, 5.4.4, 5.6.5 and on a Cloud instance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36318].
  {panel}

When you export a space to XML and use the "Custom Export" option, then content properties of pages that are not exported (due to restrictions) will get exported.

When you import such an export file you will end up with entries in the os_propertyentry table that have no link to a corresponding page. These entries are unreachable from now on and will not get deleted when you delete the space.
Consequentially every further import of the space will fail with a duplicate key exception.   

{code}
Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: could not insert: [bucket.user.propertyset.BucketPropertySetItem#BucketPropertySetItem[entityId=2129925,entityName=confluence_ContentEntityObject,key=com.k15t.scroll.versions.scroll-page-title,type=6,boolean=false,string=,text=Restricted,int=0,double=0.0,long=0,date=]]
{code}

h2. Steps to reproduce
1. Create a space
2. As user A (with 'restrict pages' permission) create a new page and use a plugin that uses content properties to store stuff (e.g. create a task list)
3. As user A restrict view and edit to user A
4. As user B (e.g. spaceadmin) export the space to XML with "Custom Export"
5. You can find the content properties in the entities.xml, but no corresponding page object
6. Delete the space
7. Import the space export
8. Delete the space. You will still find the content properties in the os_propertyentry table.
9. Import the space again and get the error from above.
fields.summary: Export custom XML exports content properties (os_propertyentry) for pages that are not included

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36297].
  {panel}

During an issue creation it's very possible that instead of the {{Create}} button the {{Cancel}} one to be clicked upon. It would be much better to separate these two.

Some suggestions:
- either confirm the Cancel action by prompting the user
- realign the buttons in such a way that they aren't that close to each other and is not easily possible to cancel by mistake (for example when a touchpad on a Laptop is used, it's very easy to cancel by mistake)
fields.summary: Better prevention for canceling ticket creation by mistake
